p: Cellulose was isolated from rice straw as described in our previous study [28]and converted into nanocellulose by 2 h ultrasonication-assisted hydrolysis in 65 wt.% H2SO4 at 45 °C [29]. The obtained nanocellulose precipitate was washed with water to neutral pH, centrifuged for 15 min, dried, and characterized by Fourier transform infrared (FTIR) spectroscopy, X-ray diffraction (XRD), Brunauer‒Emmett‒Teller (BET), and scanning electron microscopy (SEM).
